Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little-master cup with top of stem; interior: black-figure decoration (fired mostly red) consisting of bird (head missing; added red stripes on wing and body) to right; surrounding the tondo, three bands, alternating red and black tongues, and glazed outer area; exterior: glazed black with reserved band on lower wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "4" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0589) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
